# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple function in Julia to clean the column names. It uses `lowercase`, `strip`, `replace` functions of string. 

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Convert to lowercase and strip whitespaces from start/end
    col = strip(lowercase(col))
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    return replace(replace(col, " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
col_name = " My - Column "
cleaned_col_name = clean_column(col_name)
println("Cleaned column name is: $cleaned_col_name") # prints "my_column"
```
